poem:
Title: "In Gold and Unquiet Shadows"

Cross-world comrades, in the desert's light,
Muscle made gold, swathed in festive night. 
Chechen regiments, cheeked with obsidian beards,
Adorned by hands, carrying veiled fears. 

Dismay spun tale - New York's bitter part,
In Dubai's stage, a political art.
One small cheque, prints betrayal deep,
In Moscow's heart - a promise to keep.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘A gift to Moscow’: dismay as NYPD takes part in UAE Swat games with Chechnya and Belarus Led out by a beaming Adam Kadyrov, the son of the Chechen leader, Ramzan Kadyrov, a group of muscular men sporting black beards strode on to the brightly illuminated stage in Dubai last week to receive gold medals and a $5,000 (£3,960) cheque. The men were members of the notorious Chechen Akhmat Kadyrov special police regiment, a group". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
